clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Magnesium citrate has been used in bowel preparations prior to a colonoscopy as a cathartic agent T215 It is also used in over the counter products to relieve occasional constipation L2841 Magnesium citrate can be one of the forms used for the administration of dietary supplements L2842

contraindications.disease: The occurrence of overdose with magnesium citrate is very unlikely but some of the signs of the presence of overdose are diarrhea or severe stomach pain L2841
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: The onset of action can be as early as 30 minutes after administration with a mean onset time of approximately 2 hours and a maximum action of 4 hours The effect of magnesium citrate is highly dependent on the individual s hydration status T215
